intro: Hackelia meeboldii, commonly known as the meebold's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Hackelia meeboldii is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
